intro: Sisymbrium novae-zelandiae, commonly known as New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium novae-zelandiae is often found in open, sunny habitats such as coastal dunes and grasslands.
